question: The "Kimbanguism" is a Christain religious movement founded in which nation?
explanation: Kimbanguism is a Christain religious movement founded by Simon Kimbangu in the Democratic Republic of Congo in 1921. Its headquarters is in Nkamba Kongo Central of the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is a branch of the Christianity which abstains politics and accepts Puritan ethics; rejects violence, polygamy, magic and witchcraft, alcohol, tobacco and dancing.
